column17: This attack occurred East of Manama, near the Al Jufair base.
column18: 03/24/2003: A gas cylinder in a waste bin exploded close to the Al Jufair base in Bahrain, where the U.S. Navy's Fifth Fleet is headquartered. There were no injuries, but windows of nearby homes were shattered.
column97: A propane tank hidden in a trash bin was detonated in the attack.
column108: Windows of nearby homes were shattered.
column126: �Bomb Explodes Near U.S. Military Base in Bahrain: Al-Jazeera,� Xinhua News Agency, March 24, 2003.
column127: �Blast Near US Military Base in Bahrain Could Have Been Caused by Gas Bottle,� Agence France Press, March 24, 2003.
column128: Adnan Malik, �Explosion Shatters Windows Outside U.S. Navy Base in Bahrain,� Associated Press, March 24, 2003.

column18: 05/01/2006: An unknown number of unknown perpetrators set fire to seven cars belonging to real estate companies on the island of Sutra, Bahrain. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

column132: 04/09/2008: On Wednesday night, a Bahranian police patrol was attacked with stones and Molotov cocktails by unknown attackers in the village of Karzakan south of Manama, Al Manamah. The attack resulted in the death of one police officer and the injury of two more. No claim of responsibility was made for the incident.
column178: The specific motive for the attack is unknown or was not reported.
column211: Molotov cocktails were used in the bombing attack and stones were used in the melee attack.
column242: \"\"Bahrain Leader Urges Arrest of Protesters After Police Death"
